intro: Pentzia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in this family. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often with deep roots to access groundwater. Its unique botanical traits make it an important species in its native ecosystem.
